subject: Programming
title: Reading Code Is Harder Than Writing It
description: A 60-second lesson on Reading Code Is Harder Than Writing It.

hook.text: Joel Spolsky warned: never rewrite code from scratch. Reading old code just feels harder.

buildup.text: Writing code feels creative. Reading someone else's code feels like deciphering a puzzle.

discovery.text: Studies show developers spend 60-70% of their time reading code, not writing it.

twist.text: The temptation to rewrite comes from reading difficulty, not actual quality problems.

climax.text: Clean code bridges this gap. When reading feels easy, teams move faster and rewrite less.

punchline.text: Easy to read means easy to maintain.

quiz.question: What percentage of time do developers spend reading code?
